definition: to fit in/to get on well with others/sociable/to form a mutually supportive group
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗

sentences.english: There exits certain difference in genetic relationships of the same CVG and different CVG.
sentences.chinese: 同一亲合群不同地区的代表菌株遗传分化存在差异。

sentences.english: I became a lot more social when I moved from my smaller town to the larger city of Winnipeg.
sentences.chinese: 当我从小镇搬到大城市温尼伯市，我变得更加合群了。

sentences.english: But an only child isn’t necessarily a loner, misfit and brat.
sentences.chinese: 但独生子女并不必然就会孤独，不合群并且淘气。

sentences.english: So, my master said, I am unsocial.
sentences.chinese: 所以，师父说我很不合群。

sentences.english: My mother despairs of me; she thinks me lazy and unsociable .
sentences.chinese: 母亲十分担心我，她认为我懒惰且不合群。

sentences.english: It's allowed Mia to become much more sociable.
sentences.chinese: 这款软件让米亚变得更加合群了。
熊是不合群的孤僻的动物。

sentences.english: He is a gregarious man; he enjoys the companionship of a large mumber of friends .
sentences.chinese: 他是个合群的人，喜欢和一大堆朋须一起。

sentences.english: My daughter will not assort with people of her own age.
sentences.chinese: 我女儿和她的同龄人不合群。

sentences.english: After male hen live together as a group, of rooster would occurrence mightiness of contend for accidentally a Dou.
sentences.chinese: 公母鸡合群后，公鸡之间会发生强烈的争偶斗架。

sentences.english: I’m a real people person and love being around others.
sentences.chinese: 我是很合群的人，喜欢和别人在一起。

sentences.english: My does not like getting on well with others, uncommunicative emaciated girl.
sentences.chinese: 我一个不爱合群，沉默寡言的瘦弱女孩。

sentences.english: She is very shy and does not mingle with the children at school.
sentences.chinese: 她十分害羞，在学校不合群。

sentences.english: When you go out, you'd learn how to fit in with the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 到了外面，你可得学着点怎样合群。
